title: At International Court of Justice, a week of testimonies on Israel's legal obligations for aid to Gaza
summary: The humanitarian blockade on aid for Gaza over the past two months and Israeli obstructions to the UN agency for Palestinian refugees were debated at the international court. The judges' opinion is expected soon, though it might go unheeded.

title: Trump axes NSA Waltz after chat group scandal, appoints him as UN ambassador
summary: The move constitutes a major shake-up of Trump's national security team, just weeks after it was announced Waltz was leaving the administration.  Waltz will now face scrutiny for his decision to share sensitive military plans on Signal during the Senate confirmation process.

title: Zelensky, ahead of Russian drone attack on Ukraine, says minerals deal with US is 'truly equal'
summary: The strike came after Zelensky urged allies to step up pressure on Moscow to end its invasion. As for the landmark deal, Trump initially described the arrangement as 'money back' for the wartime aid Ukraine received under his predecessor Joe Biden. However, Ukraine says the agreement is not linked to any past 'debt' and the US stressed that the accord signalled support for Ukraine.

title: Apple expects $900 million tariff hit as it shifts US iPhone supply to India
summary: Apple CEO Tim Cook said on Thursday that the company expects US tariffs to cost $900 million in the current quarter, even though their impact was 'limited' at the start of this year. While iPhones produced in mainland China still account for the majority of US shipments, production in India ramped up toward the end of the quarter, according to Canalys research manager Le Xuan Chiew.

title: May 1 rallies draw more than 300,000 across France
summary: This year's Labor Day took place amid a divided trade union movement, with complaints of violence toward center-left marchers. Nonetheless, the protesters were united in solidarity against the 'Trumpification of the world': There is not 'a single worker today who is not worried about what Trump is doing and rising racism.'

title: In South Korea, the return of 'helicopter' parents
summary: 'Parents from Elsewhere.' Twice a month, one of our foreign correspondents explores parenting beyond our borders. Overprotection or legitimate concern? Many South Korean parents constantly hover over their children.

title: US meets Syria top diplomat, urges action
summary: Since the Islamist fighters toppled Assad, sectarian clashes have repeatedly flared. The spiritual leader of the Druze community on Thursday alleged a 'genocidal campaign' after two days of violence left 102 people dead.

title: In China, Pope Francis leaves his mark on parishes of the 'official' Church
summary: While Beijing did not send a representative to the funeral of the head of the Catholic Church in Rome, Chinese followers at the Notre-Dame-de-Lourdes parish in Shijingshan have been paying tribute to the Argentine pontiff.

title: Africa struggles to defend its interests against Donald Trump
summary: The continent is not a priority for the American president, and Washington's policies, caught between a trade war and aid reductions, risk long-term impacts on African economies.

title: Tesla sales in France plummet further, down 59% in April
summary: After first-quarter data from a European body showed Tesla sales had dropped 45% across Europe, a French report has added weight to analyses linking Elon Musk's political activities to his company's flagging sales.

title: Musk loses much (but not all) by working with Trump
summary: By deciding on drastic federal spending cuts and promoting his opinions bordering on the far right, the billionaire has compromised his reputation and fortune.

title: Transgender women barred from women's football by English and Scottish Football Associations
summary: These new rulings will apply to all women's football at amateur and professional levels in both countries.

title: Sudan: RSF paramilitary fighters strike the Khartoum presidential palace
summary: Sudan's regular army and its Rapid Strike Forces paramilitary group have been fighting since April 15, 2023. The conflict has killed tens of thousands and thrown the country into a severe humanitarian crisis.

title: Speed of insect population collapse confirmed by citizen science experiment
summary: Thousands of Britons regularly recorded the impact of insects using their car license plates, revealing a staggering 63% decline in these flying creatures between 2021 and 2024.

title: Lily of the valley: When an Internatonal Workers' Day tradition in France 'becomes bourgeois'
summary: Over 1 million French households purchased lily of the valley flowers in 2024, a volume that's declining over several years. The flower, linked to International Workers' Day, is still produced in western France, but now mainly comes from Hamburg, observes Le Monde's Laurence Girard.

title: Léon Marchand makes his grand return to competition, with new challenges in mind
summary: The French Olympic champion is back in the pool on Thursday at a meet in Florida. It's an opportunity to test his freestyle at the start of the season before preparing for the World Championships in Singapore this summer.

title: In the Highlands, bedrooms fit for lords
summary: In Scotland's wildest region, a famous Swiss gallery-owning couple, Iwan and Manuela Wirth, have restored the noble Fife Arms to its former glory. This 19th-century Victorian-style hotel is adorned with artworks from their collection.

title: Rare earths: China's fearsome weapon in the trade war with Donald Trump
summary: The Chinese government has implemented export controls on seven strategic rare earth metals, over which China holds a near-monopoly and thus controls the supply chain.
